de.engehausen.treemap.impl

Class GenericTreeModelEx<N,T extends java.lang.Number>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.engehausen.treemap.impl.GenericTreeModelEx<N,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    N - the type this model holds
    T - the weight type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGenericWeightedTreeModel<N,T>, ITreeModel<N>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScientificModel

    public class GenericTreeModelEx<N,T extends java.lang.Number>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGenericWeightedTreeModel<N,T>
    Sample weighted tree model implementation for generic weights. In addition to the weighted tree model interface this implementation allows adding nodes to the tree, which is of course needed to build the model.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenericTreeModelEx(NumberArithmetic<T> numberArithmetic)
      Creates an empty generic tree.

      Creates the tree from the given information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericTreeModelEx

        public GenericTreeModelEx(NumberArithmetic<T> numberArithmetic)
        Creates an empty generic tree.
        Parameters:
        numberArithmetic - the arithmetic to use, must not be null.

      • GenericTreeModelEx

        public GenericTreeModelEx(NumberArithmetic<T> numberArithmetic,
                  java.util.Map<N,java.util.List<N>> childMap,
                  java.util.Map<N,N> parentMap,
                  java.util.Map<N,T> weightMap)
        Creates the tree from the given information.
        Parameters:
        numberArithmetic - the arithmetic to use, must not be null.
        childMap - mappings "parent to child list", must not be null.
        parentMap - mappings "child to parent", must not be null.
        weightMap - weights per node, must not be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getArithmetic

        public NumberArithmetic<T> getArithmetic()
        Returns the number arithmetic instance for the model.
        Specified by:
        getArithmetic in interface IGenericWeightedTreeModel<N,T extends java.lang.Number>
        Returns:
        the number arithmetic instance for the model, never null.

      • add

        public void add(N node,
       T weight,
       N parent)
        Adds the given node to the parent and propagates the nodes' weight upwards to the root.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add, must not be null.
        weight - the weight of the node
        parent - the parent of the node; if the parent is null the given node will be the root node of the model.

      • add

        public void add(N node,
       T weight,
       N parent,
       boolean propagateWeights)
        Adds the given node to the parent and propagates the nodes' weight upwards to the root.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add, must not be null.
        weight - the weight of the node
        parent - the parent of the node; if the parent is null the given node will be the root node of the model.
        propagateWeights - true to propagate the weight of the given node upwards to its parents, false otherwise.

      • getWeight

        public T getWeight(N node)
        Description copied from interface: IGenericWeightedTreeModel
        The precise weight of the node.
        Specified by:
        getWeight in interface IGenericWeightedTreeModel<N,T extends java.lang.Number>
        Parameters:
        node - the node for which to return the weight.
        Returns:
        the weight of the node, or a value representing zero if the node is not known. Never returns null.

      • hasChildren

        public boolean hasChildren(N node)
        Description copied from interface: ITreeModel
        Indicates whether the passed in node has children or not.
        Specified by:
        hasChildren in interface ITreeModel<N>
        Parameters:
        node - the node for which to indicate whether there are children or not.
        Returns:
        false if there are no children; please note that returning true always is a valid implementation.
